title: Find lost product key for windows - Microsoft Q&A
text: To recover your lost product key for Windows, you can try the following methods: - Check Your Microsoft Account: If your Windows 10 was activated with a digital license linked to your Microsoft account, you may be able to retrieve your product key from your account. Log in to your Microsoft account and check your order history or services. - Use Command Prompt: You can use the Command Prompt to try to retrieve the product key from your current installation. Open Command Prompt as an administrator and enter the following command: This may display the product key if it is stored in the system.wmic path softwarelicensingservice get OA3xOriginalProductKey - Third-Party Software: There are various third-party tools available that can help you recover your Windows product key from the system registry. Ensure you use reputable software to avoid any security risks. - Contact Microsoft Support: If you cannot recover the key using the above methods, contacting Microsoft Support may be necessary. They can assist you in reassigning your digital license to your new hardware if you provide them with the necessary information about your previous installation. Keep in mind that if you upgraded from Windows 10 to Windows 11, your previous Windows 10 product key should still be valid for activation unless there have been significant hardware changes that require a new license.
